page.title: 17The changing landscape
page.content: Future development of the area will be extensive as the new city expands. There are plans for a senior school and 2 first schools, a shopping precinct, sports centre, a prison and several thousand housesfor Shenley Church End alone. Great advances are anticipated in construction and heating of housing in the Energy Park. The prison to be built between Oakhill and Shenley Woods seems to be the most controversial development only for those living within a very close range. The village children do not want lots of houses in the green fields now surrounding them, but want new shops and playgrounds. Older villagers feel sad that the character of the area will change with theinflux of so many people. The lane linking the villages will become a seperate enclave within the grid system.
